The patient was evaluated by the vascular surgery team in the ED and does not have any acute issues. Outpatient bactrim will be replaced with linezolid, and the wound vac will be managed according to vascular surgery management. Follow-up with vascular surgery is recommended.

The patient has diabetes mellitus type 2, which is very well controlled with a last A1c level of 5.9. Regular insulin should be continued for sliding scale, and NPH should be held for now.

The patient also has peripheral vascular disease and arterial insufficiency ulcers on lower extremities bilaterally. Prophylaxis with subcutaneous heparin is recommended.

Access is through peripherals, and the code status is full (discussed with the patient). The patient is pending clinical improvement and may be considered for transfer to the floor once stable.
